#  How to Apply for an E-passport Replacement 

Modified on: Tue, 19 Aug, 2025 at 6:12 PM

_Do you have an upcoming_ _trip, and your passport is lost, damaged, stolen, or expired? Quickly apply for an e-passport replacement on[ www.irembo.gov.rw](<http://www.irembo.gov.rw>) and receive it on time. _

 _  
_

_The service is provided by the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration(DGIE).  
  
IMPORTANT: Note that you should NOT submit an e-Passport replacement application if you are replacing the discontinued passport issued by DGIE before 28 June 2019. If you are replacing this type of passport, you need to apply through the service “e-Passport First Application.”._

  1. # What are the requirements to apply for e-Passport replacement?

  * The replacement fee depends on the e-passport category, with an additional penalty of 50% of the fee if the replacement is for reasons other than expiry.

  * Required attachments vary by passport type, validity, and applicant's age, as outlined in the tables below.

  * For replacements due to theft, you will be requested to provide a Declaration of Loss from RIB.

Applicant: Below 18 years  
---  
Passport Type| Passport Validity | Fees (Rwf)| Attachments  
Service| 5 years | 22,500  
15,000 (if expired)| 

  * Citizen application number (child ID) for a minor below 16 years old.
  * Copy of National ID
  * Passport Photo 
  * Signature (Write the names of the child)
  * A recommendation letter issued by a government institution
  * Other attachments, depending on the selected "Minor Category," 

  
Ordinary| 2 or 5 years| 37,500  
25,000 (if expired)| 

  * Copy of National ID
  * Passport Photo 
  * Signature (Write the names of the child)
  * Other attachments, depending on the selected "Minor Category," such as birth certificate, parents' marriage certificate, etc.

  
Diplomatic| 5 years| 75,000  
50,000 (if expired)| 

  * Copy of National ID
  * Passport Photo 
  * Signature (Write the names of the child)
  * A recommendation letter issued by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs or Cabinet Resolutions
  * Appointment letter of the parent
  * Other attachments, depending on the selected "Minor Category,"

  * A recommendation letter issued by a government institution

  * A recommendation letter issued by MOFA or Cabinet Resolutions
  * Appointment letter of the parent.

  * Copy of National ID

  * A recommendation letter issued by MOFA or Cabinet Resolutions

# 2\. Steps to apply for an e-passport replacement

1\. Visit [www.irembo.gov.rw](<http://www.irembo.gov.rw/>) and under Immigration and Emigration, click on the e-Passport Application. 

2\. Select which request type you want, e-Passport replacement, and click Apply.

3\. Choose who needs this service; whether the applicant is above 18 or below 18, and fill in the Applicant Details. 

  * If an applicant is above 18, he/she enters their national ID number.

  * If an applicant is below 18, he/she enters the Citizen Application Number. 

4\. Fill in the Passport & Travel Details (including Reason for Replacement) for the applicant. 

  * The price depends on the e-passport category, plus the penalty of 50% of the initial payment. 

5\. Attach all the required documents in the right format and size. 

6\. Click on Next to process. 

  

7\. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click on Submit.

8. A billing number/ID (88….) will be generated for payment. You can then choose your preferred payment method. Click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001146862-how-to-pay-for-a-service>) to learn how to pay for a service. 

# 3\. What to expect after submitting your application?

Step 1: Your application will be submitted to the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration (DGIE) for review.

Step 2: Once your application is approved, you will be notified when your passport is ready for pickup.

Note (for pick-up):

  * If you are in Kigali, go to the DGIE Headquarters.

  * If you are outside Kigali, visit the DGIE office at your district headquarters.

  * If you are outside Rwanda, visit the Rwandan Embassy in your country of residence.
